senses.sense: (transitive, informal) To cook (something) in a manner which causes that sound.
examples: I sizzled the bacon for a few minutes in the pan.

senses.sense: (intransitive) To be exciting or dazzling.
examples: The song sizzled with energy.

senses.sense: (countable) The sound of water boiling on a hot surface.
examples: We heard the sizzle of the onions hitting the pan.

senses.sense: (countable, informal) The process of being cooked which involves that sound.
examples: Give them a sizzle for a few more minutes before serving.

senses.sense: (uncountable) Zing, zip, or pizazz; excitement.
examples: Her performance had a lot of sizzle.

senses.sense: simple past tense and past participle of sizzle
One who, or that which, sizzles.
(slang) A person who is very sexually attractive.
An Indian dish of meat and vegetables served sizzling on a hot plate.

plural of sizzle

Hot enough to make a hissing sound.
(in the names of dishes in Asian cuisine etc.) Brought to the table in the metal dish it has been cooked in, making such a sound.
(informal) Exciting and intensely emotional or sexual.
(informal) Very skilful or impressive.
examples: The two teams played a sizzling match.

senses.sense: Such a hissing sound.
In a sizzling manner.
examples: He dumped a new batch of burgers sizzlingly onto the barbecue.
